description.narrative: The purpose of this initiative is to transform the former school for fundamental education for girls into a women's vocational school. The schooling is intended to females with an age range from 16 to 26 years. In this project these 60 women are provided b y 3 years vocational schooling aiming for the profession of cosmetologist and hairdresser. At school supplementary skills such as company management and knowledge on the worker's rights are taught. After the schooling the females will have the necessary sk ills for running an own company or to keep up with continuation education. The direct benefit of the project goes to the women who will get an opportunity to provide a living to themselves and their children. Empowered women will also be more aware of thei r rights and this awareness is expected to spread out and reach approximatively 600 women in Somalia. Thus the project aims to contribute to the general developement of equality in Somalia where the possibilities for vocational schooling for the traditiona l female professions are scarce. The project also aims for durable development by taking into account the environmentally-friendly ways of educating the profession of a cosmetologist and a hairdresser.
